column4: EU court backs Austria in Amazon row over levies

column5: NICOSIA  July 11 Italian energy company ENI  will start exploratory drilling for natural gas off Cyprus in the second half of 2014  its chief executive said on Thursday.

column5: DETROIT Philip Caldwell  the first CEO of Ford Motor Co  from outside the Ford family  died at his home Wednesday.

column5: MUMBAI  July 11 Ford Motor Co is recalling the diesel version of its newly launched EcoSport compact sports utility vehicle (SUV) in India to fix a potential problem with the glow plug module  which is used to help in starting diesel engines.

column4: South Korea to review bids on $7.3 billion fighter jet deal
column5: SEOUL South Korea is set to decide next week whether to proceed with an auction on supplying 60 next generation fighter jets worth 8.3 trillion won ($7.31 billion) after rounds of failed bidding  a defense official said on Thursday.

column4: Lockheed  Italy cancel ceremony at Italian F-35 plant

column4: Exclusive: U.S. still plans to send F-16s to Egypt in coming weeks
column5: WASHINGTON The United States still plans to go through with the delivery of four F-16 fighter jets to Egypt in the coming weeks  U.S. defense officials told Reuters on Wednesday  even after the Egyptian military's ouster of President Mohamed Mursi.

column5: NEW YORK  July 11 Sprint Corp on Thursday unveiled new pricing for its wireless service and offered its customers a guarantee of unlimited data services for as long as they keep their account  with the No. 3 operator  in an effort to fight back against its bigger rivals Verizon Wireless and AT&T Inc.

column4: Fitch Affirms Sprint Nextel's IDR at 'B+'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  July 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the Issuer Default Rating  (IDR) and long-term debt ratings of Sprint Nextel Corporation and its  subsidiaries (together  Sprint). In addition  Fitch has removed Sprint and its  subsidiaries from Rating Watch Positive  and assigned them a Stable Outlook. A  full list of ratings follows at the end of this release.  KEY RATING DRIVERS The rating affirmation reflects Fitch's view that Spr

column4: UPDATE 1-Regulator approves lower access fees at Telecom Italia
column5: MILAN  July 11 Italian telecommunications regulator AGCOM on Thursday tentatively approved lower fees for rivals to use Telecom Italia's fixed-line network  sparking criticism from the Italian phone company.

column4: Regulator approves lower fees for Telecom Italia copper network
column5: MILAN  July 11 Italian telecommunications regulator has approved lower fees for wholesale services to access Telecom Italia's copper network  as it moves ahead with a regulatory review aimed at smoothing a transition to new generation networks.

column4: Europe's top telecoms groups in competition probe
column5: BRUSSELS/PARIS Europe's competition watchdog is investigating some of the region's biggest telecoms companies over whether they abused their market position in deals with internet companies to deliver content to consumers.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. retailers' sales rise  some shoppers are cautious
column5: * Gap same-store sales up stronger than expected 7 percent

column4: Fitch: U.S. Bank M&A Activity Poised to Rise as Market Dynamics Change
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  July 11 (Fitch) The U.S. banking industry is poised for a potential  rise in M&A activity over the immediate term  mainly among smaller and  more-regional focused institutions  according to a new Fitch Ratings report.  This report provides a more comprehensive follow up to a Fitch comment on bank  M&A published July 10.  Fitch believes there is a need for bank M&A activity based  in part  on  increased cost structures for most

column4: BRIEF-Unilever ups stake in Hindustan Unilever to 67 pct
column5: LONDON  July 11 Unilever PLC :  * Increases its stake in hindustan Unilever from 52.48% to 67.26%

column4: Valero sees lower second-quarter earnings as costs rise
column5: HOUSTON U.S. refining company Valero Energy Corp  on Thursday said it expects lower second-quarter earnings as the price of some of the crude oil it processes rose.

column4: UPDATE 1-Valero sees lower Q2 earnings as costs rise
column5: HOUSTON  July 11 U.S. refining company Valero Energy Corp on Thursday said it expects lower second-quarter earnings as the price of some of the crude oil it processes rose.

column4: TABLE-US May ICSC retail sales rose 3.9 pct vs year ago
column5: July 11 U.S. comparable chain store sales rose 3.9 percent in June from a year earlier  the International Council of Shopping Centers said in a preliminary report on Thursday.     Total comparable sales do not include Wal-Mart Stores Inc's    figures.            YEAR/YEAR PCT CHANGE    JUNE-P MAY    APR    MAR    FEB    JAN Total comparable        3.9    3.2    3.0    1.4    1.7    4.5  Total less drug store   5.3    4.7    4.9    2.2    4.1    5.1 -----------------------------------

column4: Flint Hills to buy Platinum Ethanol plant in Iowa
column5: July 11 Flint Hills Resources said on Thursday it will acquire Platinum Ethanol's plant in northwestern Iowa  a facility with an annual capacity of 110 000 million gallons.
